contentrichtext.text: '''Ode Records''' was a [[record label]], started by [[Lou Adler]] in [[1967 in music|1967]] after he sold [[Dunhill Records]] to [[ABC Records]]. It was distributed by [[Columbia Records|CBS Records]] until 1969. Between 1970 and 1976 the label was distributed by [[A&M Records]], from 1976 onward it was again distributed by CBS Records. Adler deactivated the label several times including another short run with A&M in 1989 as Ode Sounds. It was disbanded when A&M was sold to [[PolyGram]] in late [[1989 in music|1989]]. Ode is now part of [[Sony Music Entertainment]] (now the owner of A&M's one-time distributor [[RCA Records]]), but the [[Cheech & Chong]] catalogue is controlled by [[Warner Music Group]] and the soundtrack to ''[[The Rocky Horror Picture Show]]'' is still owned by Adler. ==Artists== * [[Spirit (band)]] * [[Carole King]] * [[Merry Clayton]] * [[Tom Scott (musician)|Tom Scott]] * [[Cheech & Chong]] * [[Scott McKenzie]] * [[Peggy Lipton]] * [[The Comfortable Chair]] * [[The Rocky Horror Show]] * [[The Rocky Horror Picture Show]] * [[The Blossoms]] * [[Jan Berry]] == See also == * [[List of record labels]] ==External links== * [http://www.onamrecords.com/Ode_Records.html Ode Records] Ode Records history with US and international discographies, Billboard performance, artist roster. [[Category:American record labels]] [[Category:Record labels established in 1967]] [[Category:Record labels disestablished in 1989]] [[Category:Columbia Records]] [[Category:Ode Records albums| ]]
